thread.title: How to Positively Impact Students in the Classroom as a School Counselor
thread.title_full: How to Positively Impact Students in the Classroom as a School Counselor

author: Brittany Spinney
title: How to Positively Impact Students in the Classroom as a School Counselor
text:
School counselors play an important role in creating educational environments where students can thrive academically, socially and emotionally. For educators interested in making a difference as school counselors, Southeastern Oklahoma State University offers an Master of Education (M.Ed.) in School Counseling online program.
Research suggests that schools with counseling programs tend to have higher attendance rates and fewer discipline issues. This connection between counseling presence and positive school outcomes isn’t coincidental but reflects the collaborative work counselors perform daily. Southeastern’s faculty consists of former school counselors, enriching the curriculum with their personal experiences.
Counselors offer teachers strategies for understanding student behavior through a mental health lens, while teachers provide counselors with observations about student interactions and performance. This program prepares professionals to address the diverse needs of students through evidence-based counseling approaches.
Supporting Emotional Well-Being in Academic Settings
School counselors recognize that students struggle to focus on their education when facing emotional challenges. School counselors provide:
- Individual counseling sessions during school hours
- Provide group support for students experiencing similar challenges
- Classroom guidance lessons on managing emotions
- Stress reduction techniques students can use during tests or challenging assignments
Counselors help students develop emotional regulation skills that directly translate to better classroom behavior and improved focus. When students learn to identify and express their feelings appropriately, they spend more time engaged in learning activities and less time in behavioral disruptions.
Mental Health Awareness and Education
School counselors provide mental health education for the entire school community. They train teachers to recognize warning signs of common mental health concerns, provide resources to families about supporting their children’s emotional health, organize school-wide awareness campaigns that normalize mental health discussions and link students and families with mental health services in the community. This proactive approach to mental health awareness helps remove stigma and encourages students to seek help before minor issues become major barriers to learning.
Counselors help create a setting where every student feels welcome and respected. They help establish this inclusivity by:
- Advocating for underrepresented student populations
- Consulting with teachers on creating culturally responsive lessons
- Facilitating peer connection programs that foster a sense of school community
- Resolving bullying issues promptly and effectively
Counselors often lead initiatives that celebrate diversity and promote acceptance. These efforts contribute to school climates where students feel safe to participate fully in their education without fear of judgment or rejection. Counselors also analyze data to identify students who are struggling before they fall too far behind. This early intervention approach includes academic success planning for students who show early warning signs, organization and study skills coaching, monitoring attendance patterns and addressing barriers to regular attendance and facilitating communication between home and school when performance declines.
When counselors address academic concerns promptly, students are more likely to maintain confidence in their abilities and stay motivated to succeed. The positive influence of school counselors extends beyond individual student success. Schools with strong counseling programs often report a more positive school culture and climate, increased parent engagement and satisfaction, higher graduation rates and post-secondary enrollment, and decreased behavioral incidents requiring administrative intervention. When counselors serve as vital members of the educational team, the entire school community reaps the benefits of their expertise.
Educational Pathway to School Counseling
When counselors and teachers work together, the entire school benefits. This creates a support network that addresses both academic progress and emotional wellness. This collaboration results in classrooms where students experience both academic challenges and emotional support. When facing difficulties, students benefit from having multiple trusted adults who communicate with each other about their needs.
Southeastern’s online M.Ed. in School Counseling is ideal for those without nearby options, the flexible format also suits any schedule. With smaller class sizes, faculty members get to know students and offer tailored feedback and mentoring.
School counselors play an important role in ensuring student success. Their work addresses the full spectrum of student needs, creating conditions where academic achievement becomes both possible and sustainable. By partnering with teachers, families and community resources, counselors help transform schools into environments where students can flourish.
